subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 20 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live: Holland U21 v England U21
England take on Holland in the semi-finals of the European Under-21 Championship.



 
Thaksin targets Eriksson for City
Sven-Goran Eriksson will be offered the Man City manager's job if Thaksin Shinawatra takes control, BBC Sport understands.



 
Vieira fears Henry's Arsenal exit
Former Arsenal skipper Patrick Vieira tells the BBC Thierry Henry will leave the Gunners if the club does not bring in several world-class players.








GOLF




Casey and long-time caddy split
Paul Casey parts with long-term caddy Craig Connolly ahead of the BMW International Open.



 
Woods becomes father of baby girl
Tiger Woods has become a father for the first time after his wife Elin gave birth to a baby daughter.



 
Cabrera secures Wentworth place
Angel Cabrera's US Open win seals a place in the HSBC World Match Play Championship at Wentworth.








MOTORSPORT




Alonso happier after Indy result
Fernando Alonso claims tensions at McLaren have eased since he aired his grievances before the US GP.



 
Toseland wary of switch to MotoGP
World Superbike Championship leader James Toseland says he will not switch to MotoGP unless he can secure a ride with one of the top teams.



 
Hamilton 'could save British GP'
Lewis Hamilton's success in Formula One could help Silverstone retain the British Grand Prix, according to the British Racing Drivers' Club.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso happier after Indy result
Fernando Alonso claims tensions at McLaren have eased since he aired his grievances before the US GP.



 
Hamilton 'could save British GP'
Lewis Hamilton's success in Formula One could help Silverstone retain the British Grand Prix, according to the British Racing Drivers' Club.



 
Hamilton's kart sells for £42,100
A kart belonging to racing driver Lewis Hamilton's has sold at auction raising £42,100 for charity.








ATHLETICS




Greene pulls out of European Cup
An ankle injury forces Welshman David Greene to withdraw from the Great Britain team for this weekend's European Cup.



 
Devonish best dashed by mistake
Marlon Devonish could see his 100m personal best removed from the records because of an administrative mistake in Oslo.



 
Idowu shines in Golden League win
Phillips Idowu beats the world's best triple jumpers to claim the opening Golden League meeting in Oslo.








CYCLING




Cavendish backs anti-doping drive
Britain's Mark Cavendish signs the International Cycling Union's new anti-doping charter.



 
T-Mobile sack Ukrainian Honchar
Serhiy Honchar is sacked by his T-Mobile team for violating their code of conduct.



 
Moreau secures Dauphine victory
Frenchman Christophe Moreau wins the Dauphine Libere after a rain-hit final stage is won by Alexandre Vinokourov.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Mohamed Al Fayed on 'stupid' footballers, plus Angel Cabrera and Sir Viv Richards



 
Angel delight
Robbo on why it cheers him to see out-of-shape sportsmen winning trophies



 
Review of the week
Michael Vaughan hits the town as Messi keeps his hand in
